page.title: 03EDUCATION IN A RURAL AREA
page.content: WITH INCREASING DIFFERENTIATION IN LEVELS OF SCHOOLING THE NUMBERS OF SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN AT THE PRIMARY LEVEL HAS DECLINED THEREBY CAUSING ADMINISTRATIVE PROBLEMS FOR VILLAGE SCHOOLS. INDEED MANY ARE CURRENTLY UNDER THREAT OF CLOSURE BECAUSE OF FALLING ROLLS. HOLDENBY VILLAGE SCHOOL HAS BEEN CLOSED MANY YEARS AND LOCAL CHILDREN HAVE TO TRAVEL TO NEARBY VILLAGES WHILST OLDER ONES TRAVEL TO A SECONDARY SCHOOL AT GUILSBOROUGH. THE PEOPLE OF SPRATTON HAVE BOTH A PRIMARY SCHOOL AND A PRIVATE (FEE-PAYING) ONE. CLIENTS OF THE LATTER COME FROM A FAIRLY WIDE AREA TO BE PREPARED FOR THE LOCAL PUBLIC (FEE-PAYING) SCHOOLS. THE TWO SPRATTON SCHOOLS FOLLOW A FAIRLY SIMILAR CURRICULUM BUT WITH DIFFERING EMPHASIS ON THE COMPONENT PARTS.PRIVATE SCHOOLS TEND TO PUT MORE EMPHASIS ON ENGLISH AND MATHEMATICS.
